rev.comment: +non-free; this has rapidly become the #1 article for non-free usage on the entire project. Take a step back and re-evaluate the necessity of all this non-free content.
rev.diff:
Line 1: Line 1:   +
{{non-free}}
'''Banknotes of the Philippine peso''' are issued by the [[Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas]] (Central Bank of the Philippines) for circulation in the [[Philippines]]. The smallest amount of legal tender in wide circulation is 20 [[Philippine peso|peso]] and the largest is 1000 peso. The front side of each banknote features prominent people in the country's history while the reverse side depicts landmarks and events in history. While the 5- and 10-peso denominations have been concurrently offered in coins in recent years, the 5- and 10-peso notes have not been demonetized.
'''Banknotes of the Philippine peso''' are issued by the [[Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas]] (Central Bank of the Philippines) for circulation in the [[Philippines]]. The smallest amount of legal tender in wide circulation is 20 [[Philippine peso|peso]] and the largest is 1000 peso. The front side of each banknote features prominent people in the country's history while the reverse side depicts landmarks and events in history. While the 5- and 10-peso denominations have been concurrently offered in coins in recent years, the 5- and 10-peso notes have not been demonetized.
